title: Scale Function Implementation
description: This function, SCALE_B4, scales four input bytes (in1, in2, in3, in4) based on the provided minimum and maximum values for each input, a scaling factor K, and an offset O. The final output is a real number that results from the scaling calculation.
name: SCALE_B4

input.name: in1
input.description: First input value to be scaled.

input.name: in2
input.description: Second input value to be scaled.

input.name: in3
input.description: Third input value to be scaled.

input.name: in4
input.description: Fourth input value to be scaled.

input.name: K
input.description: Scaling factor to adjust the output.

input.name: O
input.description: Offset value added to the final result.

input.name: in1_min
input.description: Minimum value for the first input.

input.name: in1_max
input.description: Maximum value for the first input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in2_min
input.description: Minimum value for the second input.

input.name: in2_max
input.description: Maximum value for the second input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in3_min
input.description: Minimum value for the third input.

input.name: in3_max
input.description: Maximum value for the third input. Defaults to 1000.0.

input.name: in4_min
input.description: Minimum value for the fourth input.

input.name: in4_max
input.description: Maximum value for the fourth input. Defaults to 1000.0.

output.name: SCALE_B4
output.description: The scaled output value based on the provided inputs, minimums, maximums, scaling factor, and offset.

return_value.description: The final scaled and offset output value.
